intro: Veronica cymbalaria var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed speedwell, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue to violet flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
